About MOSI
Leadership
MOSI Leadership Team
Scroll
.page-intro-scroll
.page-intro
.layer-gradient
spacer
Leadership
Board of
Directors
MOSI is operated by the Museum of Science & Industry Foundation, a 501(c)3 not-for-profit organization that is managed by the president and a volunteer board of directors made up of community leaders.
The foundation is a private, non-profit corporation that seeks to inspire the public through hands-on, minds-on experiences involving science, technology, and various industries. Sources of revenue include admissions, public and private contributions, membership, and community events. MOSI is closed on Thanksgiving Day and Christmas Day.

Celebrate Space Week at MOSI Oct 4–10, 2025! Experience hands-on science, daily space themes, scavenger hunts, and exclusive evening events.
Strengthen your team with MOSI's team building workshops. Boost communication, build trust, and enjoy museum access for a memorable day!
Explore Science at the Saunders, a free event at MOSI in Tampa, featuring star tours, expert talks, and Q&A sessions

Keep Discovering
.marquee-text
spacer
About Us
Tampa Bay's Science Center, Where Discovery Meets Fun
We are a scientific playground full of interactive exhibits and educational programming. Visitors to MOSI can expect to enjoy more than 50,000 square feet of hands-on activities and exhibits, as well as enjoy unique experiences like a Saunders Planetarium show or brave the heights of the Skytrails ropes course. We also offer a full menu of science programming and events including field trips, overnight programs, camps, adult events and so much more.
spacer
.picture-content-pic
MISSION STATEMENT
MOSI's Mission and Vision
MOSI is the intersection of science, technology and innovation in the Tampa Bay region where conversations and learning happen, knowledge is exchanged and new ideas are celebrated.
Our Leadership
.picture-content-body
.picture-content-row
.picture-content
spacer
H
I
S
T
O
R
Y
wrapper start
spacer
Our History
Over 60 years of Science and Innovation
Since its inception in 1962 as the Museum of Science and Natural History located in Sulphur Springs, MOSI has been a beacon of education and innovation. In 1980, it found a new home in North Tampa, fully emerging as the Museum of Science & Industry in 1982.
Over the years, MOSI has continually expanded, adding attractions like the Saunders Planetarium in 1988 and a groundbreaking 1993 expansion featuring the state’s only IMAX Dome Theatre. In 1996, the Back Woods Nature Trail and BioWorks Butterfly Garden brought the wonders of nature to our visitors.
The nexus of science, technology, and innovation in the Tampa Bay region
In 2001, the Gladys Shafran Kashdin Welcome Center transformed MOSI into the 5th largest science center in the United States. “Kid’s In Charge!” became the largest children’s science center in the country in 2005, while 2010 saw the addition of the thrilling Sky Trail Ropes Course.
In 2017, MOSI made strategic changes to ensure sustainability. Today, our mission is to be the nexus of science, technology, and innovation in the Tampa Bay region—where conversations flourish, learning thrives, knowledge is shared, and new ideas are celebrated.
In 2025, MOSI proudly unveiled the new Saunders Planetarium & Digital Dome Theatre, a state-of-the-art immersive experience unlike any other. As the largest planetarium in Florida and the second largest in the United States, it offers breathtaking journeys through space, science, and storytelling on an extraordinary scale.
